1.text: Better is the poor man, that walketh in his simplicity, than a rich man that is perverse in his lips, and unwise.

2.text: Where there is no knowledge of the soul, there is no good: and he that is hasty with his feet shall stumble.

3.text: The folly of a man supplanteth his seeps: and he fretteth in his mind against God.

4.text: Riches make many friends: but from the poor man, even they whom he had, depart.

5.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished: and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.

6.text: Many honour the person of him that is mighty, and are friends of him that giveth gifts.

7.text: The brethren of the poor man hate him: moreover also his friends have departed far from him. He that followeth after words only, shall have nothing.

8.text: But he that possesseth a mind, loveth his own soul, and he that keepeth prudence shall find good things.

9.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished: and he that speaketh lies, shall perish.

10.text: Delicacies are not seemly for a fool: nor for a servant to have rule over princes.

11.text: The learning of a man is known by patience and his glory is to pass over wrongs.

12.text: As the roaring of a lion, so also is the anger of a king: and his cheerfulness as the dew upon the grass.

13.text: A foolish son is the grief of his father: and a wrangling wife is like a roof continually dropping through.

14.text: House and riches are given by parents: but a prudent wife is properly from the Lord.

15.text: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep, and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.

16.text: He that keepeth the commandment, keepeth his own soul: but he that neglecteth his own way, shall die.

17.text: He that hath mercy on the poor, lendeth to the Lord: and he will repay him.

18.text: Chastise thy son, despair not: but to the killing of him set not thy soul.

19.text: He that is impatient, shall suffer damage: and when he shall take away he shall add another thing.

20.text: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayst be wise in thy latter end.

21.text: There are many thoughts in the heart of a man: but the will of the Lord shall stand firm.

22.text: A needy man is merciful: and better is the poor than the lying man.

23.text: The fear of the Lord is unto life: and he shall abide in fulness without being visited with evil.

24.text: The slothful hideth his hand under his armpit, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth.

25.text: The wicked man being; scourged, the fool shall be wiser: but if thou rebuke a wise man he will understand discipline.

26.text: He that afflicteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is infamous and unhappy.

27.text: Cease not, O my son, to hear instruction, and be not ignorant of the words of knowledge.

28.text: An unjust witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.

29.text: Judgments are prepared for scorners: and striking hammers for the bodies of fools.
